alert.note: Alert for Rio Blanco (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 6:57PM MDT until August 02 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Colorado, including the following county, Rio Blanco. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 656 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to training thunderstorms north of Meeker. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in north of Meeker. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Curtis Creek, Little Beaver Creek, Sheep Creek, Smith Gulch, White River, Lone Tree Creek, Sulphur Creek, Coal Creek, Flag Creek and Strawberry Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Meeker.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
